metadata.case_name: Civil Appeal No. 1533 of 1971 and connected matters
metadata.case_number: Civil Appeal Nos. 1533, 1797 and 1798 of 1971; Special Leave Petition (Civil) Nos. 3254 and 3268 of 1971

facts.text: Co-operative Societies held annual general meetings under section 32 of the U.P. Co-operative Societies Act, 1965 and elected members of the Committee of Management.

Registrar of U.P. Co-operative Societies issued circular dated 5 November 1969 interpreting rule 409 of U.P. Co-operative Societies Rules, 1968, stating all members of general body exercise right of vote in filling all seats of elected Directors.

Shamli Cane Development Union Ltd., Shamli, U.P. registered under Co-operative Societies Act, 1912, deemed registered under 1965 Act; bye-laws provide Committee of Management of 14 members elected from 14 constituencies by delegates of each constituency; election dates: nominations 13 Oct 1970, scrutiny 17 Oct 1970, withdrawal 19 Oct 1970, poll 28 Oct 1970.

Registrar by letter dated 14 October 1970 directed election by all representatives of the area, not just related constituencies; each delegate to have as many votes as members to be elected (14 votes).

Election petition No. 140 of 1970 filed under rule 229(2) of Co-operative Societies Rules, 1967; S.D.O. Arbitrator, Muzaffarnagar by judgment dated 18 September 1971 set aside election of Management Committee of Co-operative Cane Development Union, Shamli.

In Sahkari Ganna Vikas Samiti Ltd., Iqbalpur, District Saharanpur, Arbitrator under sections 70 and 71 set aside election; appeal under section 98(i)(h) dismissed by District Magistrate Registrar, Saharanpur on 18 September 1971.

In Sahkari Ganna Vikas Samiti Ltd., Laksar, District Saharanpur, Arbitrator under sections 70 and 71 set aside election; appeal under section 98(i)(h) dismissed by District Magistrate, Saharanpur on 16 September 1971.

In Sahkari Ganna Vikas Samiti, Sarsawa, Arbitrator under sections 70 and 71 set aside election; appeal under section 98(i)(h) dismissed by Registrar, Co-operative Societies, District Magistrate Saharanpur on 16 September 1971.
District Authority, Bulandshahr set aside election of Committee of Management of Co-operative Cane Development Union Ltd. on application under rule 229 of U.P. Co-operative Societies Rules, 1968.

legal_issues.text: Whether the Registrar had power to issue the circular interpreting rule 409
Whether that interpretation of rule 409 is correct in terms of the Act and the Rules
Whether right of vote for election of member of Committee of Management is confined to delegates of that particular constituency or extends to all constituencies

petitioner_arguments.text: Section 20 of the Act provides one vote in the affairs of the society; constitution of Committee of Management is principal affair, so each member entitled to cast as many votes as strength of Committee.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 20 U.P. Co-operative Societies Act, 1965; Rule 105

petitioner_arguments.text: Every member would have one vote for each member of Committee of Management.

court_reasoning.text: Rule 409 does not confer power on Registrar to interpret or express views on voting rights; society may with previous sanction divide membership into groups and specify proportion for representation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Registrar has no power to interpret rule 409 or regulate voting rights by giving more than one vote.

court_reasoning.text: Under rule 409, division into constituencies on territorial or rational basis for suitable representation; voting by delegates of particular constituency only, to ensure representation from that group/area/interest.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Circular allows voting outside constituencies, striking at root of representation and one member one vote principle.

court_reasoning.text: Section 20 provides one vote irrespective of shareholding; affairs of society include Committee election, but through constituency representative; multiple votes defeat purpose.
court_reasoning.key_observation: One member one vote for his constituency; Rule 105 relates to meetings resolutions, not elections.

holdings.text: Registrar's circular dated 5 November 1969 is illegal and unwarranted; no power to interpret rule 409 or give members more than one vote.
At election of Committee members, one member has only one vote for the constituency to which he belongs.
Elections held following the circular are bad.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Co-operative Societies Act, 1965
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs voting rights (one member one vote), Committee of Management election at annual general meeting, election disputes and appeals; interpreted to limit votes to own constituency.

statutes_cited.name: U.P. Co-operative Societies Rules
statutes_cited.relevance: Rule 229 for election petitions; rule 409 for dividing membership into groups/constituencies for representation with Registrar sanction; rule 105 for meetings, not elections.

outcome.summary: The three appeals by special leave and two special leave petitions dismissed; elections held following Registrar's circular declared bad.

key_quotes.text: a member of a Co-operative Society shall notwithstanding the quantum of his interest in the capital of the Society have one vote in the affairs of the Society.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core principle of one member one vote under section 20.

key_quotes.text: The impeached circular of the Registrar is illegal and unwarranted. Registrar has no power to interpret rule 409.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Direct holding on Registrar's lack of authority.

key_quotes.text: At an election of members of the committee of management one member will have only One vote for the constituency to which he belongs.
key_quotes.speaker: court
